title: Synth It Like KITTI: Synthetic Data Generation for Object Detection in Driving Scenarios
author: Richard Marcus (Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg), Christian Vogel (Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg), Inga Jatzkowski (e:fs TechHub GmbH), Niklas Knoop (e:fs TechHub GmbH), Marc Stamminger (Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg), ...
relevance_why: The study offers insights into synthetic data generation, which could be applied to improve audio-related tasks that rely on sparse datasets, similar to those in audio processing.
background: Generating synthetic datasets to enhance the accuracy of object detection systems in autonomous vehicles using LiDAR point clouds.
contribution: This paper introduces a generator pipeline using the CARLA simulator to create synthetic datasets that closely resemble real-world LiDAR data, achieving strong generalization on the KITTI dataset.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggled with the transferability of synthetic data to real applications, resulting in poor object detection accuracy.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes domain randomization strategies and realistic sensor modeling to enhance synthetic data realism, improving the performance of models when applied to real-world scenarios.

key_innovation: Integration of advanced techniques such as domain randomization and realistic LiDAR sensor emulation within the CARLA framework for synthetic data generation.
real_world_impact: Potential applications in training and improving autonomous driving systems, enhancing the safety and efficiency of vehicle navigation in real-world environments.
limitations: No explicit mentions of limitations, but the reliance on synthetic data may still introduce unseen biases.

new_terms.LiDAR: **Light Detection and Ranging**: A remote sensing method that uses light in the form of a pulsed laser to measure variable distances to the Earth.
new_terms.domain randomization: **Domain randomization**: A technique in machine learning that involves training models on a wide variety of simulated situations to improve generalization to real-world scenarios.

open_sourcing: The simulation scripts and processed synthetic datasets are available at https://github.com/richardmarcus/synth-it-like-kitti.
